description: A tragic story of the American Dream, set in the Jazz Age of the 1920s, exploring love, wealth, and social status.
A chilling vision of a totalitarian future where the government controls everything, even thought itself.
A powerful novel on racial injustice and moral growth in the American South during the 1930s.
A story of teenage rebellion and isolation, told through the eyes of the disenchanted Holden Caulfield.
A dystopian society where technology and mass consumerism suppress individuality and freedom.
The epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsession with hunting the white whale, Moby Dick, exploring themes of fate and revenge.
A sweeping historical novel that intertwines personal drama with the events of the Napoleonic Wars in Russia.
Bilbo Baggins' adventure into the world of dwarves, elves, and dragons, marking the beginning of the Lord of the Rings saga.
The love story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, set against the backdrop of early 19th-century England and social expectations.
The epic quest of Frodo Baggins and his companions to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
